Code Review ACK eeddd1c8fa96cf546b0bf92063cefa4fd8c6b415\n\nChecked against my node.

ACK mainnet, testnet, and signet eeddd1c8fa96cf546b0bf92063cefa4fd8c6b415

Did not check the updated `m_assumed_blockchain_size` and did not run with reindex-chainstate & assumevalid=0 as mentioned in [https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/release-process.md#before-branch-off](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/release-process.md#before-branch-off):

> This upd

> assumevalid=0\n\nAssuming that the previous assumevalid was valid, then just syncing to the tip should be sufficient. Obviously running `assumevalid=0` is still useful to catch rejection of past blocks, but this seems unrelated to bumping the assumevalid value.

post-merge ACK mainnet [eeddd1c](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/eeddd1c8fa96cf546b0bf92063cefa4fd8c6b415)

````

{
  "time": 1626697539,
  "txcount": 656509474,

}
